name: New Testament Questions Quiz | New Testament | 10 Questions

questions.text: In what town was Jesus born?
questions.explanation:
Bethlehem.

	The story of Jesus' birth to a virgin mother is recorded in the Gospels Matthew and Luke.  Both of these books also lists the genealogy back to Adam.

questions.text: What was St Paul's other (original) name?
questions.explanation:
Saul.

	He became known as Paul after his conversion experience on the road to Damascus, when he heard God say 'Saul, Saul why do you persecute me?'

questions.text: What is the name of Mary and Martha's brother?
questions.explanation:
Lazarus.

	This Lazarus was raised from the dead by Jesus. Another Lazarus features in the parable of the rich man and Lazarus the beggar.

questions.text: Who is generally considered to have been the first Christian martyr?
questions.explanation:
Stephen.

	Stephen was killed by stoning, witnessed by Saul who guarded the killers' cloaks. This is the first martyrdom recorded in the Bible.

questions.text: Who was Judas's replacement among the twelve disciples?
questions.explanation:
Matthias.

	This is explained in Acts.

questions.text: Where was the wedding feast at which Christ performed his first miracle?
questions.explanation:
Cana.

	He turned water into wine.

questions.text: At the Last Supper, Christ broke bread and blessed the wine. What did he wash?
questions.explanation:
Feet.

	He washed his disciples' feet as a symbol of his humility and service to humanity.

questions.text: Which of the four Evangelists has traditionally been credited with being the author of the Book of Revelation?
questions.explanation:
John.

	St John the Divine is traditionally viewed to have written the Book of Revelation on the island of Patmos.

questions.text: Who was crucified along with Christ?
questions.explanation:
two thieves.

	Christ told the repentant thief, 'This day you will be with me in Paradise'.  Three Gospels state that these men were thieves - Matthew 27:38, Mark 15:27, Luke 23:32, and the Gospel of John (19:18) does not specify their crimes.

questions.text: One of the names Christians give to Jesus comes from the prophecies of Isaiah, who assigned this name to the Messiah. It means 'God is with us.' What is this name?
questions.explanation:
Immanuel.

	'Behold, a virgin shall conceive, and bear a son, and shall call his name Immanuel.' (Isaiah 7:14, King James Version)
